attributes.action: agree to give a written response to any petition that receives 50,000 or more signatures
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Petitions with large numbers of signatures can expire with no official response.
The government can currently choose to ignore petitions it does not agree with in spite of large numbers of signatories.

rejection.details: Comments about the petitions system should be sent to number10@petitions.pm.gov.uk. When a serious petition closes usually provided there are 500 signatures or more, officials at Downing Street will ensure you get a response to the issues you raise. Depending on the nature of the petition, this may be from the Prime Minister, or he may ask one of his Ministers or officials to respond. Depending on the issue, this can sometimes take time.
reasons: Potentially libellous, false, or defamatory statements
Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
